p: In Japan, the Food Recycling Law was established in 2001 [ 50], which establishes that companies and industries in the food chain (from agricultural production to consumption) are participants in reusing waste and reducing food waste. This law encouraged companies such as Eco-Farm to use plant residues from food industries to make organic fertilizers that are used in crops that supply the raw material in food production [ 51]. In countries such as Korea, Taiwan, and Thailand, food waste is promoted and regulated by-laws to feed for ruminants, pigs, and poultry [ 52].
